**COURSE DESCRIPTION**

The goal of this course is to help students develop their English proficiency so that they will be able to comprehend and use English in the courses they study in their major and in their daily lives. Through a series of talks/presentations, discussions, and projects, students are also expected to learn to think critically about the issues addressed in class.

**Delivery of instruction**

1.  Lecture
2.  Group discussion & cooperation (Quality Talk)
3.  Student presentation

**How-to****: experiment and demonstration (4 people in one group)**

Before the presentation

1.  study about how something is done,
2.  make sure that you can show/teach your classmates how to do it in English,
3.  pick 3 useful English vocabulary or phrases and 2 discussion questions,
4.  discuss with the instructor ONE WEEK before your presentation.

On the presentation day

1.  give a brief introduction,
2.  show and teach your classmate how it works,
3.  answer questions from your classmates, and
4.  lead group discussions.

References

[https://www.howitworksdaily.com/](https://www.howitworksdaily.com/)

[https://www.sciencenewsforstudents.org/](https://www.sciencenewsforstudents.org/)

[https://www.youtube.com/user/VOALearningEnglish/videos](https://www.youtube.com/user/VOALearningEnglish/videos)

**Movie Reviews****: Individual or pair, audio/video**

Clips from movies, sitcoms, TED-talks, and news clips are fine.

1.  pick a science movie/sit-com/news report on an issue/discovery
2.  introduce this movie to your classmates
3.  prepare a transcript (or a script) with 3 useful expressions
4.  share with classmates why you like the movie
5.  upload it to MOODLE

1.  Each student is required to watch/listen to 2 videos and leave comments.

**REQUIREMENTS & RULES**

1.  When you write to the instructor, please ALWAYS put **00UB9C2** or **English for Science** in the subject line and identify yourself in the email. Otherwise, messages WON’T be read.
2.  You are expected to preview before you attend the class meeting. Please be a responsible student.
3.  You will be asked to work in pairs and in groups. Please be a responsible partner.
4.  Attendance is important. Please show up on time. A notification of absence form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統). It is also the students’ own responsibility to catch up with the class after their absence.
5.  Please make sure that you have your Moodle account and check both the course site and your email regularly. Not receiving a notice/an email is NOT an excuse for absence or late submission.
